discourse_list.title: MIP26c6 Delegation -- Desperately Seeking Vote Delegation

content.content: MIP26: DssGov - Governance Contract Redesign   MIP26c6 Delegation   How far away are we from MKR Vote Delegation? It is becoming more and more worrisome that we have to rely on one human to have Executives/Polls pass/voted on–that one human is known as KhanMaker. And as much as I am thankful for Khan, I am sad that the Community cannot make things happen. We have so many good people here willing and ready to participate–day in, day out, for the benefit of the DAO. What can be done temporarily while we wait for Vote Delegation? At this point I’m ready to provide my personal credentials, KYC/AML and ask other Whales to delegate to me. And YOU should as well. Unconventional, I know–but I have nothing hide, and the only think I want is for the success of this DAO to come into fruition, and help DeFi completely change the spectrum of traditional finance. “Governance can also be extremely time and energy consuming”. And perhaps as @Planet_X had mention on a previous post, perhaps we should consider Governance Minimization. Or, perhaps not. If the argument for on-chain governance is that–“it can allow protocols to evolve faster” community die-hards like @Aaron_Bartsch and @ultraschuppi have to time and time again ask for voter participation the old fashion way–by pleading. Therefore, such argument is proving to be untrue.  If the intention here is to prove that on-chain governance causes faster protocol evolution, have we really succeeded? And finally–I’ll leave you with some thoughts made by Fred Ehrsam: image818×294 14 KB
content.GPT-summary: The author of the post is expressing concern about the reliance on one person for voting on Executives/Polls in the DAO. They suggest temporary solutions such as personal credentials and KYC/AML to delegate votes. The post also questions the effectiveness of on-chain governance and suggests the possibility of Governance Minimization. The post asks for feedback and collaboration while also raising questions about the current system.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is asking for feedback
3rd party or author wants to collaborate on proposal

content.content: My hope is that once Liq 2.0 is passed and the Smart Contract Core Unit proposals pass we will begin to see more horizontal scaling into being able to tackle more of these problem spaces at the same time. There are sooooooo many improvements down the pipe that it’s hard not to be optimistic. The key is being able to get there fast enough that our competitors don’t leave us in the dust and we go the way of Bitshares.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving entirely positive feedback on proposal
